newsitem.title: USA: Novopharm gets FDA approval for ulcer drug.
newsitem.headline: Novopharm gets FDA approval for ulcer drug.

text.p: Pharmaceutical company Novopharm USA Inc said on Monday that it had received approval to market a generic version of Zantac, an ulcer drug with U.S. sales of $1.63 billion.

The approval, granted by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration, follows six years of legal battles over marketing rights to the drug, which is a Glaxo Wellcome Plc product, Novopharm said in a statement.

The FDA granted marketing approval to Novopharm as part of a marketing exclusivity agreement with a third company called Genpharm Inc, which agreed to waive all its exclusivity rights to sell the drug to Novopharm until August 29, the company said.
"A satisfactory business arrangement was worked out between Novopharm and Genpharm and as a result Novopharm will be the sole distributor of the product in the United States," Novopharm said.
Novopharm USA Inc is a division of Novopharm Ltd of Scarborough, Ontario.
Genpharm Inc is a Canadian-based subsidiary of Germany's Merck KGaA.
